title: 2 Euro - Benedictus XVI (Saint Paul the Apostle)

composition.text: Bimetallic: nickel brass clad nickel centre in copper-nickel ring

obverse.description: The coin depicts the conversion of Paul on the road to Damascus, which is visible in the background. Dazzled by a light from the sky, he falls from his rearing horse. To the left of the image is an inscription denoting the issuing country ‘CITTÀ DEL VATICANO’, and to the right the legend ‘ANNO SANCTO PAULO DICATO’, as well as the year ‘2008’, the mint mark ‘R’ and the artist’s name ‘VEROI’. The initials of the engraver ‘L.D.S. INC.’, Luciana De Simoni, appear beneath the image. The outer ring of the coin shows the 12 stars of the European Union.
obverse.lettering:
CITTÀ DEL VATICANO ANNO SANCTO PAULO DICATO
2008
R
VEROI
L.D.S.INC.
obverse.lettering_translation:
City State of Vatican
St. Paul

reverse.description: A map, next to the face value, shows the European continent without borders.

commemorated_topic: The Year of St. Paul – the 2000th Anniversary of his Birth
comments:
As follows - (mintage)
85,000 - Folder BU
6,084 (that was issued in circulation)
15,000 - Philatelic Numismatic Cover BU

This is the folder/coincard that the coin was issued in

edge.description: Finely reeded with inscription: six times the digit "2" and a star, alternately upright and inverted

mints.name: Istituto Poligrafico e Zecca dello Stato
